result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharon J Reuterskiold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: RESTITUTION SUPPLEMENT

Defendant Sharon J Reuterskiold in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Theft, party to a crime 943.20 (1)(a)(3a) and Ct. 2 to Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Counts 1 & 2.  Atty Klopp agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Counts 1 & 2.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Klopp makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
Restitution = $875.00 + 10% Surcharge = $962.50; joint and several as per the supplement

Defendant Sharon J Reuterskiold in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the information.  Court questions Atty Klopp.  Atty Klopp states that the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.    Defendant stands mute. Defendant Sharon J Reuterskiold in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Defendant waives her right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant on her waiver.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions:  *Appear for booking.  No contact with August Fetting, John and Jenny Kutzler.  Arraignment scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
